title.raw: 卷二 惠帝紀 Volume 2: Annals of Emperor Hui

sentences.zh: 孝惠皇帝，高祖太子也，母曰呂皇后。

translations.idiomatic: Emperor Hui was Gaozu's crown prince. His mother was Empress Lü.
translations.text: Emperor Hui was Gaozu's crown prince. His mother was Empress Lü.

sentences.zh: 帝年五歲，高祖初為漢王。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor was five years old when Gaozu first became King of Han.
translations.text: The emperor was five years old when Gaozu first became King of Han.

sentences.zh: 二年，立為太子。

translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he was established as crown prince.
translations.text: In the second year, he was established as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十二年四月，高祖 崩。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, fourth month, Gaozu passed away.
translations.text: In the twelfth year, fourth month, Gaozu passed away.

sentences.zh: 五月丙寅，太子即皇帝位，尊皇后曰皇太后。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month on the day bingyin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne. He honored the empress as empress dowager.
translations.text: In the fifth month on the day bingyin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne. He honored the empress as empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵一級。

translations.idiomatic: He granted the people one rank each.
translations.text: He granted the people one rank each.

sentences.zh: 中郎、郎中滿六歲爵三級，四歲二級。

translations.idiomatic: Attendants-in-ordinary and palace gentlemen who completed six years received three ranks, four years received two ranks.
translations.text: Attendants-in-ordinary and palace gentlemen who completed six years received three ranks, four years received two ranks.

sentences.zh: 外郎滿六歲二級。

translations.idiomatic: Outer gentlemen who completed six years received two ranks.
translations.text: Outer gentlemen who completed six years received two ranks.

sentences.zh: 中郎不滿一歲一級。

translations.idiomatic: Attendants-in-ordinary who did not complete one year received one rank.
translations.text: Attendants-in-ordinary who did not complete one year received one rank.

sentences.zh: 外郎不滿二歲賜錢萬。

translations.idiomatic: Outer gentlemen who did not complete two years were granted ten thousand cash.
translations.text: Outer gentlemen who did not complete two years were granted ten thousand cash.

sentences.zh: 宦官尚食比郎中。

translations.idiomatic: Eunuchs and food officials ranked equal to palace gentlemen.
translations.text: Eunuchs and food officials ranked equal to palace gentlemen.

sentences.zh: 謁者、執楯、執戟、武士、騶比外郎。

translations.idiomatic: Usher attendants, shield bearers, halberd bearers, warriors, and grooms ranked equal to outer gentlemen.
translations.text: Usher attendants, shield bearers, halberd bearers, warriors, and grooms ranked equal to outer gentlemen.

sentences.zh: 太子御驂乘賜爵五大夫，舍人滿五歲二級。

translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's carriage attendants were granted the rank of grand master, retainers who completed five years received two ranks.
translations.text: The crown prince's carriage attendants were granted the rank of grand master, retainers who completed five years received two ranks.

sentences.zh: 賜給喪事者，二千石錢二萬，六百石以上萬，五百石、二百石以 下至佐史五千。

translations.idiomatic: Those who provided for funeral affairs: officials of two thousand piculs received twenty thousand cash, six hundred piculs and above received ten thousand, five hundred piculs and two hundred piculs and below down to assistant clerks received five thousand.
translations.text: Those who provided for funeral affairs: officials of two thousand piculs received twenty thousand cash, six hundred piculs and above received ten thousand, five hundred piculs and two hundred piculs and below down to assistant clerks received five thousand.

sentences.zh: 視作斥上者，將軍四十金，二千石二十金，六百石以上六金，五百石以下至佐史二金。

translations.idiomatic: For those who oversaw construction and reported upwards: generals received forty jin of gold, officials of two thousand piculs received twenty jin, six hundred piculs and above received six jin, five hundred piculs and below down to assistant clerks received two jin.
translations.text: For those who oversaw construction and reported upwards: generals received forty jin of gold, officials of two thousand piculs received twenty jin, six hundred piculs and above received six jin, five hundred piculs and below down to assistant clerks received two jin.

sentences.zh: 減田租，復十五稅一。

translations.idiomatic: He reduced land taxes, restoring the fifteen percent tax.
translations.text: He reduced land taxes, restoring the fifteen percent tax.

sentences.zh: 爵五大夫、吏六百石以上及宦皇帝而知 名者有罪當盜械者，皆頌繫。

translations.idiomatic: Grand masters and officials of six hundred piculs and above and eunuchs who served the emperor and were known by name who had crimes deserving shackles for theft were all pardoned and released.
translations.text: Grand masters and officials of six hundred piculs and above and eunuchs who served the emperor and were known by name who had crimes deserving shackles for theft were all pardoned and released.

sentences.zh: 上造以上及內外公孫耳孫有罪當刑及當為城旦舂者，皆耐為鬼薪白粲。

translations.idiomatic: Grand builders and above and inner and outer grandsons and grandsons who had crimes deserving punishment and deserving to be city wall pounders were all tattooed to become firewood cutters and rice cleaners.
translations.text: Grand builders and above and inner and outer grandsons and grandsons who had crimes deserving punishment and deserving to be city wall pounders were all tattooed to become firewood cutters and rice cleaners.

sentences.zh: 民年七十以上若不滿十歲有罪當刑者，皆完之。

translations.idiomatic: People aged seventy and above or below ten who had crimes deserving punishment were all spared.
translations.text: People aged seventy and above or below ten who had crimes deserving punishment were all spared.

sentences.zh: 又曰：「吏所以 治民也，能盡其治則民賴之，故重其祿，所以為民也。

translations.idiomatic: He also said: "Officials are what govern the people. If they can fully carry out their governance then the people rely on them, so their salaries are made heavy, because it is for the people.
translations.text: He also said: "Officials are what govern the people. If they can fully carry out their governance then the people rely on them, so their salaries are made heavy, because it is for the people.

sentences.zh: 今吏六百石以上父母妻子與同居，及故吏嘗佩將軍都尉印將兵及佩二千石官印者，家唯給軍賦，他無有所與。

translations.idiomatic: Now officials of six hundred piculs and above have their parents, wives, and children living with them, and former officials who once wore general or commandery commander seals and led troops and wore seals of two thousand piculs, their families only provide military levies, otherwise have no other levies.
translations.text: Now officials of six hundred piculs and above have their parents, wives, and children living with them, and former officials who once wore general or commandery commander seals and led troops and wore seals of two thousand piculs, their families only provide military levies, otherwise have no other levies.

sentences.zh: 令郡諸侯王立高廟。

translations.idiomatic: He commanded the commanderies and feudal lords to establish high temples.
translations.text: He commanded the commanderies and feudal lords to establish high temples.

sentences.zh: 元年冬十二月，趙隱王如意薨。

translations.idiomatic: In the first year, winter, twelfth month, King Yin of Zhao Ruyi passed away.
translations.text: In the first year, winter, twelfth month, King Yin of Zhao Ruyi passed away.

sentences.zh: 民有罪，得買爵三十級以免死罪。

translations.idiomatic: People who had crimes could purchase thirty ranks to be exempted from death penalty.
translations.text: People who had crimes could purchase thirty ranks to be exempted from death penalty.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵，戶一級。

translations.idiomatic: He granted the people ranks, one rank per household.
translations.text: He granted the people ranks, one rank per household.

sentences.zh: 春正月，城長安。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, first month, he walled Chang'an.
translations.text: In spring, first month, he walled Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 二年冬十月，齊悼惠王來朝，獻城陽郡以益魯元公主邑，尊公主為太后。

translations.idiomatic: In the second year, winter, tenth month, King Dao Hui of Qi came to court and presented Chengyang commandery to increase the fief of Princess Yuan of Lu, honoring the princess as grand empress dowager.
translations.text: In the second year, winter, tenth month, King Dao Hui of Qi came to court and presented Chengyang commandery to increase the fief of Princess Yuan of Lu, honoring the princess as grand empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 春正月癸酉，有兩龍見蘭陵家人井中，乙亥夕而不見。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, first month, on the day guiyou, two dragons appeared in a Lanling commoner's well. On the day yihai evening they disappeared.
translations.text: In spring, first month, on the day guiyou, two dragons appeared in a Lanling commoner's well. On the day yihai evening they disappeared.

sentences.zh: 隴西地震。

translations.idiomatic: Longxi had an earthquake.
translations.text: Longxi had an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 夏旱。

translations.idiomatic: Summer drought.
translations.text: Summer drought.

sentences.zh: 郃陽侯仲薨。

translations.idiomatic: Marquis Zhong of Heyang passed away.
translations.text: Marquis Zhong of Heyang passed away.

sentences.zh: 秋七月辛未，相國何薨。

translations.idiomatic: In autumn, seventh month, on the day xinhai, Chancellor He passed away.
translations.text: In autumn, seventh month, on the day xinhai, Chancellor He passed away.

sentences.zh: 三年春，發長安六百里內男女十四萬六千人城長安，三十日罷。

translations.idiomatic: In the third year, spring, he mobilized 146,000 men and women within six hundred li of Chang'an to wall Chang'an. After thirty days they stopped.
translations.text: In the third year, spring, he mobilized 146,000 men and women within six hundred li of Chang'an to wall Chang'an. After thirty days they stopped.

sentences.zh: 以宗室女為公主，嫁匈奴單于。

translations.idiomatic: He made a princess from the imperial clan and married her to the Xiongnu Chanyu.
translations.text: He made a princess from the imperial clan and married her to the Xiongnu Chanyu.

sentences.zh: 夏五月，立閩越君搖為東海王。

translations.idiomatic: In summer, fifth month, he established Lord Yao of Minyue as King of Donghai.
translations.text: In summer, fifth month, he established Lord Yao of Minyue as King of Donghai.

sentences.zh: 六月，發諸侯王、列侯徒隸二萬人城長安。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, he mobilized 20,000 convict laborers from the feudal lords and marquises to wall Chang'an.
translations.text: In the sixth month, he mobilized 20,000 convict laborers from the feudal lords and marquises to wall Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，都廄災。

translations.idiomatic: In autumn, seventh month, the imperial stables suffered disaster.
translations.text: In autumn, seventh month, the imperial stables suffered disaster.

sentences.zh: 南越王趙佗稱臣奉貢。

translations.idiomatic: King Zhao Tuo of Nanyue called himself subject and presented tribute.
translations.text: King Zhao Tuo of Nanyue called himself subject and presented tribute.

sentences.zh: 四年冬十月壬寅，立皇后張氏。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, winter, tenth month, on the day renyin, he established Empress Zhang.
translations.text: In the fourth year, winter, tenth month, on the day renyin, he established Empress Zhang.

sentences.zh: 春正月，舉民孝弟力田者復其身。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, first month, he selected filial, fraternal, and diligent farmers among the people and exempted them.
translations.text: In spring, first month, he selected filial, fraternal, and diligent farmers among the people and exempted them.

sentences.zh: 三月甲子，皇帝冠，赦天下。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month on the day jiashen, the emperor was capped. He pardoned the world.
translations.text: In the third month on the day jiashen, the emperor was capped. He pardoned the world.

sentences.zh: 省法令妨吏民者；

translations.idiomatic: He reduced laws and commands that hindered officials and people.
translations.text: He reduced laws and commands that hindered officials and people.

sentences.zh: 除挾書律。

translations.idiomatic: He abolished the law against possessing books.
translations.text: He abolished the law against possessing books.

sentences.zh: 長樂宮鴻臺災。

translations.idiomatic: Changlegong's Hongtai suffered disaster.
translations.text: Changlegong's Hongtai suffered disaster.

sentences.zh: 宜陽雨血。

translations.idiomatic: Yiyang rained blood.
translations.text: Yiyang rained blood.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙亥，未央宮凌室災；

translations.idiomatic: In autumn, seventh month, on the day yihai, Weiyang Palace's ice room suffered disaster.
translations.text: In autumn, seventh month, on the day yihai, Weiyang Palace's ice room suffered disaster.

sentences.zh: 丙子，織室災。

translations.idiomatic: On the day bingzi, the weaving room suffered disaster.
translations.text: On the day bingzi, the weaving room suffered disaster.

sentences.zh: 五年冬十月，剨；

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, winter, tenth month, it frosted.
translations.text: In the fifth year, winter, tenth month, it frosted.

sentences.zh: 桃李華，棗實。

translations.idiomatic: Peach and plum trees flowered, dates bore fruit.
translations.text: Peach and plum trees flowered, dates bore fruit.

sentences.zh: 春正月，復發長安六百里內男女十四萬五千人城長安，三十日罷。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, first month, he again mobilized 145,000 men and women within six hundred li of Chang'an to wall Chang'an. After thirty days they stopped.
translations.text: In spring, first month, he again mobilized 145,000 men and women within six hundred li of Chang'an to wall Chang'an. After thirty days they stopped.

sentences.zh: 夏，大旱。

translations.idiomatic: Summer great drought.
translations.text: Summer great drought.

sentences.zh: 秋八月己丑，相國參薨。

translations.idiomatic: In autumn, eighth month, on the day jichou, Chancellor Shen passed away.
translations.text: In autumn, eighth month, on the day jichou, Chancellor Shen passed away.

sentences.zh: 九月，長安城成。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Chang'an's city walls were completed.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Chang'an's city walls were completed.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵，戶一級。

translations.idiomatic: He granted the people ranks, one rank per household.
translations.text: He granted the people ranks, one rank per household.

sentences.zh: 令民得賣爵。

translations.idiomatic: He commanded the people to be allowed to sell ranks.
translations.text: He commanded the people to be allowed to sell ranks.

sentences.zh: 女子年十五以上至三十不嫁，五算。

translations.idiomatic: Women aged fifteen and above to thirty who did not marry were assessed five shares.
translations.text: Women aged fifteen and above to thirty who did not marry were assessed five shares.

sentences.zh: 夏六月，舞陽侯噲薨。

translations.idiomatic: In summer, sixth month, Marquis Kuai of Wuyang passed away.
translations.text: In summer, sixth month, Marquis Kuai of Wuyang passed away.

sentences.zh: 起長安西巿，修敖倉。

translations.idiomatic: He built Chang'an's western market and repaired the Ao granary.
translations.text: He built Chang'an's western market and repaired the Ao granary.

sentences.zh: 七年冬十月，發車騎、材官詣滎陽，太尉灌嬰將。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, winter, tenth month, he dispatched chariots, cavalry, and foresters to Xingyang. Grand marshal Guan Ying led them.
translations.text: In the seventh year, winter, tenth month, he dispatched chariots, cavalry, and foresters to Xingyang. Grand marshal Guan Ying led them.

sentences.zh: 春正月辛丑朔，日有蝕之。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, first month, on the day xinchou, new moon, the sun was eclipsed.
translations.text: In spring, first month, on the day xinchou, new moon, the sun was eclipsed.

sentences.zh: 夏五月丁卯，日有蝕之，既。

translations.idiomatic: In summer, fifth month, on the day dingmao, the sun was eclipsed, completely.
translations.text: In summer, fifth month, on the day dingmao, the sun was eclipsed, completely.

sentences.zh: 秋八月戊寅，帝崩于未央宮。

translations.idiomatic: In autumn, eighth month, on the day wuyin, the emperor passed away in Weiyang Palace.
translations.text: In autumn, eighth month, on the day wuyin, the emperor passed away in Weiyang Palace.

sentences.zh: 九月辛丑，葬安陵。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, on the day xinchou, he was buried at Anling.
translations.text: In the ninth month, on the day xinchou, he was buried at Anling.

sentences.zh: 贊曰：孝惠內修親親，外禮宰相，優寵齊悼、趙隱，恩敬篤矣。

translations.idiomatic: Appraisal: Emperor Hui internally cultivated closeness to relatives, externally showed courtesy to the chancellor. He favored and honored King Dao of Qi and King Yin of Zhao. His kindness and respect were sincere.
translations.text: Appraisal: Emperor Hui internally cultivated closeness to relatives, externally showed courtesy to the chancellor. He favored and honored King Dao of Qi and King Yin of Zhao. His kindness and respect were sincere.

sentences.zh: 聞叔孫通之諫則懼然，納曹相國之對而心說，可謂寬仁之主。

translations.idiomatic: When he heard Shu Sun Tong's admonition he was fearful, when he accepted Chancellor Cao's response his heart was pleased. He can be called a lenient and benevolent ruler.
translations.text: When he heard Shu Sun Tong's admonition he was fearful, when he accepted Chancellor Cao's response his heart was pleased. He can be called a lenient and benevolent ruler.

sentences.zh: 遭呂太后虧損至德，悲夫！

translations.idiomatic: He encountered Empress Lü who damaged his perfect virtue. How sad!
translations.text: He encountered Empress Lü who damaged his perfect virtue. How sad!
